info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 1:45PM EDT until April 8 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River.
Eel River at Bowling Green.
.Major flooding is occurring along the White River from Spencer on downstream due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall that brought around 5 to 9 inches to the area. The crest on the lower White was just past Spencer Monday afternoon and forecast to reach Newberry Tuesday night and Petersburg on Friday. Minor to moderate flooding continues on the upper and middle White, with the crest near Noblesville Monday afternoon and forecast to be downstream of the Indianapolis area gauges by Tuesday morning. The Eel at Bowling Green is past crest and falling.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Anderson.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters close Edgewood Park and Grand Avenue between Alexandria Pike and Broadway. If river is rising at this level, the City of Anderson notifies residents along Hazlett Street, near W 1st Street and Madison Avenue, near W 2nd Street and Sycamore Street, and along Riverside Drive to prepare for sandbagging operations and possible evacuations.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EDT Monday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 445 AM EDT /345 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON
